name: Modular Architecture
description: Single service with clear module boundaries and high internal cohesion. Monolith with strong architectural discipline - modules are decoupled enough to potentially become services later.

types.description: Modules organized by layers (presentation, business, data)
Modules organized by domain/features with clear boundaries
Modules using ports & adapters pattern internally

indicators.name: single_deployment_unit
indicators.description: One main service, one deployment artifact

indicators.name: clear_module_boundaries
indicators.description: Distinct modules with clear interfaces and dependencies

indicators.name: minimal_cross_module_coupling
indicators.description: Modules minimize direct dependencies on each other

indicators.name: module_level_testing
indicators.description: Tests organized per module for isolation

indicators.name: api_per_module
indicators.description: Each module has defined public API/exports

benefits: Single deployment simplicity while maintaining structure
Clear separation of concerns within single process
Can scale to moderately large teams with discipline
concerns: Requires architectural discipline - easier to violate boundaries
Coupling can creep back without enforcement
Harder to enforce than separate services
when_to_use: Growing from simple monolith with clarity needed
Medium teams (20-50 developers) that can maintain discipline
Complex domains benefiting from module boundaries

required_practices.description: Define public APIs for each module
Use tools to prevent circular dependencies
